041package org.jfree.chart.plot.dial;
042
043import java.awt.Shape;
044import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
045import java.io.Serializable;
046
047/**
048 * A dial frame is the face plate for a dial plot - it is always drawn last.
049 * JFreeChart includes a couple of implementations of this interface
050 * ({@link StandardDialFrame} and {@link ArcDialFrame}).
051 * <br><br>
052 * Classes that implement this interface should be {@link Serializable},
053 * otherwise chart serialization may fail.
054 *
055 * @since 1.0.7
056 */
057public interface DialFrame extends DialLayer {
058
059    /**
060     * Returns the shape of the viewing window for the dial, or
061     * <code>null</code> if the dial is completely open.  Other layers in the
062     * plot will rely on their drawing to be clipped within this window.
063     *
064     * @param frame  the reference frame for the dial.
065     *
066     * @return The window.
067     */
068    public Shape getWindow(Rectangle2D frame);
069
070}
